title: ‘This is kidnapping — plain and simple’: ICE arrests 9 employees at Allston car wash
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: ICE agents arrested nine employees at Allston Car Wash during a Tuesday morning raid, the employees had work permits.
Manager Jose Barrera said the employees were detained without a chance to show their documents due to a language barrier.
Boston City Councilor Liz Breadon criticized the raid, calling it 'kidnapping' and urged those affected to seek legal help.

title: Patriots opt to stand pat at trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots did not make any trades at the 2025 NFL trade deadline, keeping their current roster intact.
New England traded away Keion White and Kyle Dugger last week, reducing defensive depth.
Roster depth remains a concern, especially in running back and pass-rusher positions amidst injuries.

title: Amid SNAP benefit cuts, these Greater Boston food businesses are here to help
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Greater Boston food businesses offer free meals and deals amid SNAP benefit cuts during the government shutdown.
Restaurants like Seoul Kitchen and American Flatbread provide free meals to SNAP recipients and federal workers.
Local grocery stores and community groups maintain fridges and run donation programs to support residents in need.

title: Karen Read shuffles defense attorney lineup in wrongful death suit
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Karen Read changes her defense team for a wrongful death lawsuit filed by John O'Keefe's family.
Law firm Melick & Porter withdraws from the case, replaced by Tang & Maravelis attorneys.
The civil wrongful death case is scheduled for a court appearance on November 21.

title: FuGaKyu in Brookline closes after 27 years in business
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: FuGaKyu in Brookline is closing on Nov. 5, 2025, after 27 years in business.
The restaurant, famous for its sushi and shoji decor, announced closure due to owner's personal reasons.
FuGaKyu previously had locations in Lynnfield and Sudbury, which have also closed.

title: Halsey hospitalized with ‘minor medical emergency’ in between Boston shows
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Halsey hospitalized at Massachusetts General for a 'minor medical emergency' between two Boston shows.
The singer praised the medical staff, including Dr. Kian and Dr. Victoria, for their care and support.
Halsey, with known health issues, assured fans she was 'A-Okay' and prepared for her next concert.

title: 18-year-old killed in Belmont moped crash
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: An 18-year-old man from Watertown died in a moped crash with an SUV in Belmont on Tuesday morning.
The moped, observed driving erratically, collided with a Honda CRV at Stults Road and Fairview Avenue.
Both the moped rider and the SUV driver were hospitalized; the former died and the latter sustained minor injuries.

title: Feds: Nurse replaced liquid oxy with household cleaner
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Lori Robertson, a nurse from Salem, NH, pleaded not guilty to charges of tampering with liquid oxycodone.
Robertson allegedly replaced a hospice patient's oxycodone with a household cleaner at a facility in Amesbury, MA.
She faces federal charges and remains on probation awaiting a Nov. 24 court appearance for an initial status conference.

title: AG Campbell skeptical of proposed law to ban ICE agents from wearing masks
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: AG Andrea Campbell is skeptical of Massachusetts bill to ban masked ICE agents, citing limited state power over federal entities.
State Rep. Jim Hawkins and Senate President Karen Spilka support legislation prohibiting law enforcement from masking identities in public.
US Attorney Leah Foley argues ICE agents require masks for safety, referencing potential doxing and threats to agents' families.

title: Birds of Paradise, Brighton’s travel-themed cocktail bar, closes at the Speedway
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Birds of Paradise, a travel-themed cocktail bar at Charles River Speedway, closed on October 31.
The bar, launched by Ran Duan in 2022, was known for its globally-inspired cocktail menu.
An unresolved investigation related to Duan may have impacted the bar, now overseen by his colleagues.
